Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000034
Special Investigation Intake Date: October 15, 2024
License #: CP330201190
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Chad Hannahs
Agency Name: INGHAM COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 5303 S CEDAR ST
LANSING, MI 48911-3800
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 11/29/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
10/17/2024 3:00 PM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
11/13/2024 11:45 AM Phone Interview
12/17/2024 11:30 AM Phone Interview
12/17/2024 12:45 PM Phone Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff responsibilities
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be directly
Description responsible for all the following activities:
1

(a) Placing and supervising children in out-of-home care. Social
service workers shall work directly with the children, their
families, and other relevant individuals and be primarily
responsible for the development, implementation, and review of
service plans for the children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency worker didn’t maintain case management services.
Investigation It was alleged the agency worker(s) did not maintain case
management responsibilities for both the foster care and adoption
process.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by telephone on 10/17/2024.
Complainant stated Youth A and Youth B were placed in
Guardians home when the previous foster mother of Youth A and
Youth B passed away. Complainant did not have anything
additional to report.
I interviewed the guardian of Youth A and Youth B on 10/17/2024.
Guardian reported having a guardianship of Youth A and Youth B.
Guardian reported the Purchase of Services (POS) agency
assumed case management responsibilities in January 2024.
Guardian reported problems associated with medical and food
assistance and the receipt of medical services for Youth A and
Youth B.
I interviewed State Worker by telephone on 11/13/2024. State
Worker reported the referral was also made to her office, the
children’s advocate office, regarding the placement of Youth A
and Youth B in the home of Guardian and the services that were
being provided.
I interviewed Administrator 2 and Adoption Worker from the
POS agency, St. Vincent Catholic Charities, by telephone on
12/17/2024. They reported their agency is providing foster care
and adoption case management of Youth A and Youth B.
I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 12/17/2024. An
explanation was provided to Administrator 1 that this agency was
associated with this investigation due to this agency having
monitoring responsibilities and the intake identified this agency
instead of the POS agency.
2

Documents Reviewed:
The case record of Youth A and Youth B was reviewed. This
record indicated Youth A and Youth B were placed in out of home
care supervised by a POS agency and monitored by that agency
from 03/17/2022 to 4/5/2023.
Youth A and Youth B returned to out of home care supervised by
another POS agency and monitored by that agency on
08/04/2023. It was at this time that Youth A and Youth B were
placed with Guardian.
The documentation indicated Youth A and Youth B each had
dentals completed 2/29/2024 and 10/07/2024, and physical exams
completed 08/09/2023 and 05/13/2024.
Youth A and Youth B were referred for adoption 3/05/2024.
Adoption documentation indicated Child Adoption Assessments
were completed for Youth A and Youth B 4/11/2024. An
application for adoption by the prospective adoptive family was
submitted 3/26/2024 and the Family Adoption Assessment was
completed 6/12/2024 with an addendum completed 6/14/2024.
The Consent was signed by MCI on 7/19/2024. The subsidy
contracts were completed 11/22/2024 and the Court Adoption
Packet was filed 11/26/2024. A court hearing is scheduled for
12/20/2024 for adoption finalization.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the licensing requirements
as per interviews that were completed and documents that were
reviewed. The direct supervision and case management services
were provided by POS agencies while being monitored by this
agency.
Activities of the POS agencies were found in compliance as a part
of this investigation. No additional complaint allegations are
required to investigate the POS agencies.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
3

12/30/2024

Mark Hunter Date
